results.adx_keywords: Basketball;Airport Security;Hashish;Drug Abuse and Traffic;Griner, Brittney;Women's National Basketball Assn;Phoenix Mercury;Russia
results.byline: By Michael Crowley and Jonathan Abrams
results.title: Brittney Griner, Star W.N.B.A. Center, Is Detained in Russia
results.abstract: Russian customs officials said a U.S. basketball player had vape cartridges containing hashish oil in her luggage. A Russian news agency identified the player as Griner.

media.caption: A Russian news agency identified Phoenix Mercury center Brittney Griner as the American basketball player detained in Russia.
media.copyright: Paul Beaty/Associated Press

results.title: At the Bottom of an Icy Sea, One of History’s Great Wrecks Is Found
results.abstract: Explorers and researchers, battling freezing temperatures, have located Endurance, Ernest Shackleton’s ship that sank in the Antarctic in 1915.

media.caption: A view of the wreck of Endurance from a submersible.

results.adx_keywords: Russian Invasion of Ukraine (2022);International Relations;United States International Relations;Putin, Vladimir V;Xi Jinping;Russia;China;Ukraine
results.byline: By Chris Buckley and Steven Lee Myers
results.title: ‘No Wavering’: After Turning to Putin, Xi Faces Hard Wartime Choices for China
results.abstract: Beijing aligned itself with Putin as Russia prepared to invade Ukraine. Now its efforts to edge away are constrained by leadership politics.

media.caption: President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia with China’s leader, Xi Jinping, in Beijing on Feb. 4. In a joint statement, the leaders had vowed that their countries’ friendship had “no limits.”
media.copyright: Li Tao/Xinhua, via Associated Press

results.adx_keywords: Russian Invasion of Ukraine (2022);Defense and Military Forces;Civilian Casualties;Evacuations and Evacuees;Ukraine;Russia;Irpin (Ukraine);Kyiv (Ukraine)
results.title: They Died by a Bridge in Ukraine. This Is Their Story.
results.abstract: Tetiana Perebyinis and her two children were killed trying to dash to safety, a moment captured by our photographer. Her husband describes their lives, and their final hours.

media.caption: Serhiy Perebyinis lost his wife, Tetiana, and both of their children to Russian mortar shelling as they tried to flee Irpin, near Ukraine’s capital, Kyiv.
media.copyright: Lynsey Addario for The New York Times

results.title: Covid May Cause Changes in the Brain, New Study Finds
results.abstract: Brain scans before and after infection showed more loss of gray matter and tissue damage, mostly in areas related to smell, in people who had Covid than in those who did not.

media.caption: A digital model of a human brain showing the parts of the brain that lost the most gray matter in the 401 Covid-infected participants in the study, in red-yellow.
